sense.name: a mental state of being mesmerized, enchanted by something
sense.examples: The singer had the audience under her spell as she delivered the sultry tunes. I was still under the spell of the film's breathtaking ending as I left the theater.

sense.name: a magical incantation believed to have powers
sense.examples: The sorcerer cast a spell over the princess and turned her into a swan. The witch gave him an amulet to ward off evil spells.

sense.name: an indefinite span of time of some activity
sense.examples: They sat for a spell on the front porch and smoked their pipes. We had a spell of bad weather last month. Mary's recent spells of gardening have really improved the looks of her yard.

sense.name: an attack of a medical affliction
sense.commentary: SPELL[+event][+attack][+of_affliction][+medical] Note: a narrow medical usage of Sense 3
sense.examples: Grandma is having one of her spells again, better call the doctor. The patient described his spells of dizziness.
